qas.question: What state has had only a single execution?
When was the last person executed in the District of Columbia?
When did Oregon reinstate the death penalty?
In what year did an Oregon referendum succeed in restoring the death penalty, only to be shot down due to a court ruling?
What state notably abolished the death penalty and then reintroduced it, but didn't use it again?
What state has had only a double execution?
When was the first person executed in the District of Columbia?
When did Oregon reject the death penalty?
In what year did an Oregon referendum succeed in restoring the death penalty, only to be passed due to a court ruling?
What state notably abolished the death penalty and then reintroduced it, and used it frequently?

context: Other states with long histories of no death penalty include <a0_0><b5_0>Wisconsin<b5_0/><a0_0/> (the only state with only one execution), <a4_0><b9_0>Rhode Island<b9_0/><a4_0/> (although later reintroduced, it was unused and abolished again), Maine, North Dakota, Minnesota, West Virginia, Iowa, and Vermont. The District of Columbia has also abolished the death penalty; it was last used in <a1_0><b6_0>1957<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Oregon abolished the death penalty through an overwhelming majority in a 1964 public referendum but reinstated it in a <a2_0><b7_0>1984<b7_0/><a2_0/> joint death penalty/life imprisonment referendum by an even higher margin after a similar <a3_0><b8_0>1978<b8_0/><a3_0/> referendum succeeded but was not implemented due to judicial rulings.
